Title: Fundus fluorescein angiography
Abstract: © 2019 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.Fluorescein angiography is a standard investigation done for patients with nonresolving acute central serous chorioretinopathy and chronic cases to diagnose and plan treatment. More often, it is used in conjunction with other imaging modalities as part of multimodal imaging. Recognized patterns of focal leaks described as smokestack and inkblot patterns have been described for decades. Multimodal imaging, however, provides a more comprehensive diagnostic potential.
